as Elly places the gathered flowers down.  Almost reveren RESUME CROW ANGLE - ELLY B.G. as Elly takes a single white rose and places it atop the near Shelly Webster's.
TILT UP from rose to the name: ERIC DRAVEN. Rain spatters granite, darkening it. EXTREME CLOSE-UP - CROW's EYE It blinks in its alien way.
as it takes wing from it's unseen perch.  Lands stop Eric headstone.  It pecks tentatively at the top of the monume

Oh, scary. The bird blinks at her from the headstone.

as she exits the iron gates of the cemetery without looki back.  Brutal building facades, like dead eyes, and bad alleyways, like hungry mouths, are gradually revealed as continue PULLING BACK to unveil that the cemetery is smac the middle of the city.
CLOSE-UP of a foot-long hot dog being drowned in mustard.
What this place needs is a good natural catastrophe.  Earthquake, tornado...
ALBRECHT is a black beat cop, 35, in a rain slicker. MICKEY is the grease-aproned entrepreneur of MAXI DOGS, a open-front fast foodery.
You gotta put the mustard underneath first.
Maybe a flood, like in the Bible.

Here, let me do it. He grabs the dog from Mickey.  Mickey puffs his cigar whi cooks.  Albrecht methodically spreads a napkin and perfor surgery on the hot dog, coating the bun with mustard, rol the dog in the bun.  Flashes Mickey a "gimme" look.
Come on... onion.  Don't cheap out on me.  Lotta onions.
Heyyy -- it's the Elly monster.
How do you ride that thing on a  wet street?
Talent. Hi.
Care for a hot dog?
You buying?
I'm buying. Elly grabs the stool next to Albrecht.  They`ve done this
No onions though, okay?
(horror)
No onions?
They make you fart. Mickey laughs.  Spots Elly a Coke.
What's goin' on, Elly?
I went to see a friend of mine.
Well, how's your friend?
She's still dead. Albrecht and Mickey exchange a look re:  Elly's matter-of factness.
Thunder KABOOMS o.s.  The crow pecks the top of the stone and a chip of granite flies off, bang!
as the crow pecks again and draws blood from the rock.
A dot of blood on its ebony beak.
A thin, watery trickle of blood wanders from the top of t stone towards the earth.  Rain does not interfere.  Light plays in the rolling cloud cover, b.g.
as it takes off from the gravestone, into the rain.
It slowly fills the name Eric Draven into the rock.
A LOW ANGLE like the SHOT introducing Elly's boot.  This we see cowboy boots, leather chaps.  The foot taps.  Wait
as lightning strikes.  Just enough for us to see a figure long duster and a cowboy hat.
DRAVEN fills with blood.  Blood continues groundward.
Turning to meet FRAME as the crow alights on his outstret arm.  This is the SKULL COWBOY.  We glimpse the deathshea beneath the brim of the cowboy hat.
as blood trickles into the turf at the base of the grave.
shaking off rain.  Watching intently.
Black gloved.  It walks a flat silver throwing knife acro knuckles, like a quarter somersaulting.
The turf stirs beneath the white rose.  Magically, a slim parts the earth to grasp the rose. SKULL COWBOY POV - ERIC's GRAVE as the figure of Eric Draven stands up from behind his ow headstone.
Pale.  Clad in cerements: cheap black burial suit, slit o back.  WHite shirt.  A nothing tie.  No shoes.  Rain slui from his upturned face.  He looks to the sky.  Lightning.

as he weaves to lean against a nearby tree.  Looks o.s. ERIC's POV - THE SKULL COWBOY water-blurred, through the rain, standing with the crow p on his arm like a hunting falcon.  He releases it and it to the tree.
Watching this.  Wipes mud from his eyes, tries to clear v The crow lights in the tree and they meet eye-to-eye.  Er looks back o.s. and we RACK to include the Skull Cowboy.
What the hell are you?

Interested?  Follow the crow. NB.  The Skull Cowboy speaks in nicely distorted, buzzlik charnal house whisper.  Unsettling and hackle-raising. Eric turns back to the bird, which takes wing in the rain eyes follow it.  He looks back, disoriented, doubtful, bu Skull Cowboy is gone.
Taking wing in the rain, showing the way.
alone in the cemetery.  After a moments hesitation, he lu off, following the crow.
A candy-flaked muscle T-bird is parked at the curb.

A MOVING SHOT during o.s. lines.  Past dead video and pin devices.  Pasta desk with an open briefcase, coffee cup, ashtray -- someone was just there.  Then past a WOMAN, tr with duct tape to her office chair, gagged, hot fear in h darting eyes. COMPLETE CAMERA MOVE to include SKANK, a blade-thin speed with pattern baldness, always loud, jittery, a manic dust And T-BIRD, an arrogant Arayan, brush-cut iron pumper, wh prepping an incendiary.  He exhibits a small squeeze bott arson cocktail to Skank.

Uncle T-Bird's 100-proof accelerator.  I squirt you with this, you could jump in the  Detroit river and burn all the way to the bottom. INSERT A CLOSE-UP of the bomb in his hands as he works. canisters, an LED timer, wires.
You know, Lake Erie actually caught on fire once, from all the crap in it.  Wish I coulda seen that. He CLICKS a switch.  PEEP.  LED countdown blurs.
We're ready to rock. Skank notices the captive woman's handbag on the floor. it up.  Looks through it for valuables.
What about working girl? INTERCUT the woman's increasingly horrified reactions.
What about her?
I say we leave her here to fry, man. T-Bird looks casually at the woman.  Smiles hideously.
No.  Let's take her with us.
Her eyes bug in a terrified NO!
As the T-Bird fishtails wildly around the corner and eats
TB drives.  One eye on his digital watch (doing an equall fast countdown).  Skank wrestles their captive, the woman the back seat.
(pissed off)
Skank, shut her the fuck up! SKank punches her and she sags.  Then he looks forward.
Whoaaa -- T-Bird, red light, red light!
As the T-Bird slews wide, cutting sidewalk, scattering nightwalkers, immediately attracting everybody's attentio
Reacting, with a mouthful.
Goddammit. Mickey grabs the counter phone instantly.
Call it in? Albrecht is off and running for the corner already.
Yeah, do it! (to Elly)
Stay right there! HOLD ON MICKEY.  He points at Albrecht's hot dog.  Yecch.
(yelling after)
You want I should save this for you?

location: MOUTH OF ALLEY ACROSS FROM CEMETERY

text: The car slides to a nose-down panic stop.
Dump her, man, dump her! The woman comes tumbling from the car, which blasts off w war hoop from the guys inside.
Gun out, hauling ass on wet pavement.  Aims at the depart car.  Gives it up.  Still too far away.  Pedestrians in t
hurting, cut, bleeding, tottering toward the dumpster.  D stuck to her face but cut away around her mouth.  With he she falls into the alley darkness... straight into the ar

Their eyes lock.  Eric stiffens with his first FLASH. NB:  Eric's flashes of past memory are conditioned by the of things with which he makes physical contact.  Hints an fragments in fierce, super-saturated COLOR.  Puzzle piece must assemble.  Each flash keynoted by a BLOWBACK NOISE a accompanied by a degree of pain.  It hurts to remember.
The faces of Skank and T-Bird are murky, ephemeral, their hideous, distorted echoes.  A knife snaps open.  We see t blade.  Blood.  Skank hits her, pow! and --
An airborne crow POV spiralling up and away from them.
perched on a fire escape, high above, watching and waitin
She fades.  He lets her drop away, horrified.  And stagge into the cover of the alley.  Her blood is on his hands.
Skidding in, spotting the woman.  Kneeling to her.
Here now!  You're gonna be okay! Can you understand me?  I'm a police officer... The woman is no longer in pain.  Deathly calm now.
He touched me and it stopped.  The pain.
What did you say?
I saw a ghost... Her eyes roll back and she dies in Albrecht's arms.
Oh no... don't go, darlin', you stay with me, now... shit!
BOOMING BACK from Albrecht, the woman, onlookers, as poli units screech up to assist.

location: ALLEY BEHIND ARCADES GAMES SUPPLY HOUSE

text: Eric in lurching flight, panting.  Stops and steadies aga the wall across from the backside of Arcade Games.
Circling, then lighting on the fire escape above Eric.
"CROWVISION" is what the crow "gives" Eric to see.  Visua distinct and immediately identifiable.
Which he's already seen through the crow's eyes.
looking up at the crow.  Disoriented.  Doesn't understand Suddenly he cottons, and covers his eyes just in time to from:
The rear windows EXPLODING outward in a spray of fire and debris.
he reels back, crashes into a dumpster.  Falls.
landing on the dumpsters edge near a pair of discarded co boots in the trash.  Flames.
The blood from his hands mars his burial shirt.  He tears shirt away, leaving his tie absurdly intact.  Wipes his f with his shirt.  Discards it.  Stops, held by his discove

as his fingers explore the five puckered bullet punctures chest.  Almost a circle.  Comically, he feels his back fo wounds.  Then hauls himself upright, coming level with th His glance at the bird is almost accusatory. ANGLE - THe CROW Inscrutable.  We should get the idea that some silent communication is taking place.
bare, muddied, frozen.  TILT to Eric.  His gaze moves fro crow to the boots in the trash.  He grabs them, pushes th his bare feet.  His eyes catch the firelight.  Distant o.
Fire.  In the rain.

We are now within the neon techno-depths of Club Trash. music is hard, savage, primal:  a doom-laden Radio Werewo rules.  Cabaret Blitzkrieg, packed with Death-to-Yup trendazoids.  We'll see more of this circus later.  Right the BG SOUND is our biggest clue to the flavor of this establishment since we are --

Thinly filmed in dust, mounted among dozens of other band Visible among the posed members of a group called Diaboli Eric, wielding guitar on the club stage.  ND BLUR as peop CROSS FRAME. GRANGE, 45-50, powerful, a seasoned assassin, cruel but l His facade remains stony as he leads three other men bris down the corridor.:  NGO NWA, 50ish, clad Chinese gangste - white topcoat, white scarf, tinted shades - and two bod supplying a power perimeter around him,lean, dark-haired killers who would gladly die for Ngo Nwa, which they will just a minute. They have just passed the Diabolique 8X10.  Ngo Nwa's glo fingers, in passing, leave little skid tracks in the dust clear the eyes of Eric in the photo. As the foursome reaches the DOOR, Grange turns doubtfully suspiciously -- to Nwa.
He will see me... unannounced.
As Grange keys in the enter code the door hisses open.  W a word, Nwa passes inside and the door is pulled shut in Grange's face by the Bodyguards, who post themselves to e side.

The door CLOSES and the BG NOISE is GONE.  Through a larg (mirrored on the club side) all sorts of activity is visi through automatic mini-blinds.  A fly-vision bank of 12 T monitors is hot with surveillance. LAO, a painfully clean-cut, Armani-clad Asian, impeccable almost dashing, but the dynamic here is crystal clear: Nw the King: Lao, the dark prince in this hierarchy. At the desk, Lao is startled from his contemplation of a perfect rat skeleton by Ngo Nwa's unheralded entry.  The is bare except for and Arcane Vietnamese fighting knife, meter long with an ideogrammed blade, dramatically positi beneath an Artemide lamp.  Lao rises and feigns servility NB:  The following exchange will play FAST, and entirely VIETNAMESE.
(formal greeting)
(dismissiveness, contempt, then chastizing anger as:) Nwa INDICATES the blade with some ridicule.
(phony assuagement)

(knows it's bullshit) Lao turns, staring out the blinds, fighting for control. breath.  He turns back to his "master."  Nwa gestures bro the oppulent office, indicating that Lao should be gratef is somehow errant
(respect is required)
(begrudging agreement) Lao sees the blade.  An idea.  He lifts it reverently, be the Nwa hilt-first in both hands, as if bestowing a thing immeasurable worth.

(why give me this?) Nonetheless, Nwa accepts the blade.  It gleams.  Hypnotic Nwa has to admire it.  Turns it so the blade is pointed a sternum.  His attitude indicates Lao is too far away to d anything untoward.

(sinister punchline) Lao spins through the air and HEEL-KICKS the blade THROUG chest, pinning him to the door.  It's over so fast the ga astonishment never escapes Nwa.  Lao is much more than me treacherous, he is extremely capable.
(in perfect English)
When I spoke of an offering, I didn't mean an offering to you.
Grange, standing out of arm's reach in the corridor, kill Bodyguards with a double headshot as they turn in greetin door OPENS.
Lao exchanges a look with his right arm; Grange nods affirmatively.
You gonna smoke his bones now, or however it is you do it? Lao smiles indulgently.  He wipes the blood from the blad the jacket of his ex-lord.  Lao now bows to no one.
Eric, wearing the combat boots, climbs as the crow leads Up.  He jams his hand on a rusty wedge of metal.  Ouch.
Blood flows from the gash.  He vises his fist shut.
Eye-to-eye with the crow.  Opens his hand.
The blood flows back into the wound, which closes itself, leaving another scar.
Vising the rail.  Speaks to the night.  Almost a mantra.
"My kitten walks on velvet feet, and makes no sound at all.  And in the doorway nightly sits to watch the darkness fall.  I think he loves the lady night..." (to crow)
Am I alive?  Am I dead?  Something else?  Something in between?
Inscrutable.  No answer here.
Almost bemused.  Steadier.  A hint of friendliness.
Thanks for sharing that.
As the T-Bird grumbles tp park curbside.  Menacing.

A junkyard of loot and dusty discards.  Junkie thievings other people's stereos.  Behind a wire-meshed security co GIDEON reads a racing form, chain-smoking throughout the is pear-shaped, stubbled, unkempt.  Food on his shirt.  J of doorbells.  Gideon lowers his paper to reveal Skank an T-Bird on approach.
Ahhh, jesus, the creatures of the  night, here they come.  Tweedledum and Tweedledummer. Skank riles
Hey, blow me, fat boy! Just as quick, Gideon cocks and levels a Magnum at Skank.
Blow yourself, bigmouth.
(interposing)
Whoa, hey, whoa. (hands up)
Business. He lifts a small carton onto the counter.
Whatcha got?
Transaction time.  T-Bird passes items through the screen and Gideon gives each one cursory, doubtful inspection.
Coupla more rings... 24k.
18k.  Crap.
...necklace... pearls...
Nineteen bucks at Sears.  Fake,
Leather purse... He hands though the bag rested from the woman.
What's this -- a little, ah, bloodstain, right? (doesn't matter)
Fifty bucks for the box, and I'm doin' you a --
Yeah, I know, fatso.  Do us all a  favor.  Make Top Dollar smile.
You wouldn't want Top Dollar not  to smile. Mention of Top Dollar clams Gideon efficiently up.  He ha over the cash to T-Bird with a grimace.
Eric stares upward at the crow as it drops like a bomber the night sky, flying past him, skimming the roof, leadin on.  Eric exhales, shrugs, feeling mocked by the bird.

All right. And he takes off on a run.  Only to stumble and fall.  Bu falls turns into a TUMBLING ROLL that lands Eric back on still moving.  He looks back as if to ask: "Did I do that runs out of the frame. ANOTHER ANGLE - PICKING UP ERIC ON THE RUN. as he squints towards the crow and does his best to keep TRACK WITH HIM to the edge of the roof, heavily misted in He jumps a negligible gap to the next lower roof.  The ne roof-top is a one-story jump down.  Eric clears the jump WOOF of air.  Keeping his eyes on the flying crow; gainin strength.  His next leap is more like a broad-jump.  Athl
keeping airborne, keeping ahead.
Eyes confidently on the sky as he arches out into space..
As Eric is seen to jump across the gap at least three sto where there is no connecting building.
as Eric smashes into it, just missing, hinging at the wai grabbing for purchase, suddenly panicked, gravity pulling downward.

head_text.subj: AT ERIC FROM PHONE CABLE BRACKET

text: Eric falls but manages to grab the bracket one-handed.  H for another deadly moment, then slowly, to his own astoni executes a one-handed pull-up that will save his ass.
Gotcha. He completes the pull-up, bringing his chin level with th ledge.  As he reaches for it with his other hand the brac rips from the wall and Eric plummets, with a howl of defe
It's a looooooong way down.
as Eric lands and splits a trash can in two.  A beat as w if any bones are left unpulped.  PUSH IN as Eric rolls fr facedown to his back.
as he completes the roll, gasping, amazed he's still in o piece.
It flies easily down to inspect Eric as he slowly sits up examining his hands.  Frustrated and pissed off.
Thanks.
Not "your welcome", but other-worldly patience.  It waits
Where're we going next -- the sewer?
Still, dark silence until Eric lands from ABOVE FRAME, fe The crow lands simultaneously b.g., perched near a roof a door with a shaded, dim-yellow bulb.
It just blinks at him.
as Eric yanks open the rusty rooftop door from the outsid sweeps down the steps in a swirl of night mist
Trash and detritus all around, clogging the arteries of t building, which is old, unoccupied, forsaken.  The crow l on a scarred banister knob.  Eric's footsteps come down i

A year ago this door was sealed with police barricade tap which now sags, faded. A sticker across the jam notifies potential trespassers t this is -- was -- a crime scene.  Eric slows, stops, his on the banister.
as is wafts ahead of Eric, arriving at the door first.
Eric has had enough.
Are we finished yet?
sliding along, as he speaks, until it hits a cigarette bu

stiffening as he suffers his second -- FLASH:  IMAGES and DIALOG are not linked.  A rapidfire MO in the loft, a year earlier (it is decorated for Hallowee The broken door.  The stairwell is filled with cops and c noise; lab guys bustle.  Albrecht is there, making notes DETECTIVE steps over to him.
Victim's name is Shelly Webster. The guy who got tossed is, uh ...-- (checks his notebook)
Albrecht grinds out his smoke on the banister.
He sits down hard, hurting from the flash.  His eyes seek crow.  He completes Albrecht's line:
"Draven, Eric."
LOW DOLLY of Elly's little combat boots moving toward the entryway of the pit.  MUSIC gradually UP LOUDER O.s. as s nears.
Luridly-lit.  A grown-up's place.  A burly BOUNCER apprai her, his tone jokey.  He knows Elly.
Hey!  You got any ID?
Very funny.  Ha.  Ha.  Oh my, sides. The Bouncer jerks a thumb.  Go on in.

A grungy sawdust-floored shot-and-beer joint packed tight with urban BURNOUTS rushing to drink their lives away.  H MUSIC and rude whorehouse lighting.  Each predator strain be badder than the next. TRACK THROUGH this maze at Elly's eye level until we reac DARLA, waitressing her heart out, the drug mileage on her obvious.
Mom --?
I told you you're not supposed to come in here.
(a quick lie)
I lost my key. Disgustedly -- goddamn kids -- Darla fishes up a key and it into Elly's hand.
Hey, Darla -- before we die of old age, how about it --?
(to Elly)
Out.  Now.  I gotta work. RACK PAST Darla and MOVE IN CLOSE on a corner table -- wh Funboy, Skank, T-Bird and a black, vested muscle gypsy, T
As Eric shoves the door open from the outside.  The lock, from the frame, spins on the wooden floor.  The barrier t whisps and dust roils.  Dark, chilly, damp.  A rat's nest disuse.

text: as Eric enters.  Glass blown out.  Shards poking.  Jagged
He scans the loft.  Sees reflecting golden eyes near the
A white, long-haired cat walks into a pool of night light

He kneels.  Extends his hand.  The cat nears; likes Eric. CLOSE-UP - ERIC'S HAND. as the cat makes contact.  Sudden white jolt - a FLASH. FLASH:  we HEAR Eric strumming his Strat o.s.  We see wha saw:  Shelly, holding the cat.

Wincing.  Recovering from the flash.  He purposefully gat the cat into his arms and braces for more, harder, strong FLASH:  A MAN and a WOMAN make love on a big bed amidst a points of candlelight.  Shelly and Eric, once upon a time
as the cat, dropped, hits the floor and scrambles out of
vising his head, teary-eyed, his nose bleeding.
No!  Don't look!  No! No! He whirls unexpectedly and punches his fist completely th the masonry wall. FLASH:  Eric and Shelly in a mock waltz.  He spins her an collapse on the bed.
slowly pulling his arm out of the wall.
(whispering)
Stop it. His eyes roll up and he slumps the length of the door fra a drowning man.
watching Eric.  He hits with an o.s. THUD.
As a gloved hand sets up four bullets next to four shots.
Let's have some fun. Funboy pops the bullet, like a contact capsule and washes T-Bird turns to Tin-Tin, the new guy. T-BIRD        You first.
You're outta your fuckin' mind. Into it, almost jazzed, Tin-Tin downs his bullet and shot T-Bird does likewise.  Points to Skank.
No.  I'm not the lunatic.  He is. Skank riles, pulls a huge Auto Mag and sticks it in T-Bir face, cocking.
Fuck you, T-Bird. Just as lightning fast, T-Bird has his own gun out and ja right under Skank's jawbone.  He makes a kissy face.
I love you too, you madman. They all crack up laughing like ax murderers.  Skank drin Tin-Tin spot checks the satchell from Top Dollar's.  Darl delivers more shots and funboy feels her ass.
Hey, pussycat.
He's awake.  Pushes himself up.
Is perched in a dead light fixture, monitoring Eric.

He's awake.  Pushes himself up.  Realizes he is in the ce faint chalk outline on the hardwood floor.  He reaches to the dark stain of old blood. FLASH:  Shelly spills into frame, mouth bloodied.  T-Bird instantly on top of her, rough.

as he abandons the outline and staggers to the window... he cuts open his hand on jags of glass. FLASH:  Eric held firm in the grasp of T-Bird and Funboy, arm each.  Five bloody bullet holes in Eric's chest. The thugs 1-2-3 and hurl Eric backwards through the windo which shatters.
Reeling backward, same trajectory as in the Flash, but to the floor, in SLO-MO.  Overloaded.  Blacking out.

A jumble of good/bad images from the loft:  Tin-Tin embed page of paper in the loft wall with a throwing knife... Shelly's face as she lights a candle... a POPPING champag cork... the echoing CANNONADE of the shots that killed Er Skank backhanding Shelly... Shelly blowing bubbles from a clawfoot tub full of suds... Eric catching Funboy's first high in the chest... NEW ANGLE of the glass in the window blowing out as T-Bird and Funboy through Eric through...
He plummets to BLACK OUT FRAME.  THUMP.  Out cold.
Funboy contemplates his drink as the previous scene rever
More fun than a torture chamber. Tin-Tin's pocket pager goes BEEP and startles them all. nearly shoots it, jumpy.  Tin-Tin pulls back on a black l trenchcoat after clicking off the pager.
I hate this goddamn thing... ANGLE - DARLA watching them from a distance as Tin exits.

An enormous cockroach trundles past, large in FRAME.  RAC show Eric lying on floor b.g. as his eyes pop open.  A fl dark motion as the crow flies past frame. ANGLE -- THE CROW -- Having snatched the bug in it's beak it.
rising from the floor.  Careful.  Stealthy.  Watches his
We have company.
Huge.  Marble.  COld.  Eric's paper mache masks of Comedy Tragedy still hang there.  The Skull Cowboy steps out of dark and into the vague blue light.  Shadowy as ever.
Having fun yet?  No? (beat)
I'll give you a hint.  Remember whatshername?
Shelly?
Miss her?
Yes.
Kill the men who killed you both, and the Day of the Dead will be your reunion. The Skull Cowboy prestidigitates a flat throwing knife(li Tin's).  Eric's gaze follow it closely.
You must use your eyes. He points to the crow.
Weirdly distorted, a shared vision between Eric and the c
As he DUCKS out of the path of the knife he sees through bird's eyes.  He rolls.
It hops out of the way as the knife embeds in the wall. ROLL finishes him up nearby.
Goddammit. He grabs for the knife as if to use it on the Skull Cowbo the knife causes an unexpected painful FLASH. FLASH:  Eric bouncing off the bedroom doorframe, Tin-Tin' stuck in his shoulder.
vising his head with his hands, in pain.  Too much pain.
Get it?
Leave me alone -- ! He looks up, the Skull Cowboy is still there.
(contempt)
Do something about it. ANOTHER ANGLE - ERIC AND THE SKULL COWBOY. A horrible beat between them.  The Eric runs full tilt ac the room, bounding to the open window and then leaping.
as close to surprise as he gets.  Steps out to watch as -
FLIES feet first out into space.
Eric's fingers smash into grip the tiny mortared gaps!

High above, Eric's feet shoot out the window, knocking lo stray shards that fall toward frame.  He swings into an u down pose, impossibly holding himself rigid against the building's side, face down. by his quarter-inch finger gr
Every muscle rigid, quivering with tension.  Hold.  Then relaxes, and swings back inside.
He arches, flips, to land on his feet.  The Skull Cowboy gone.  No knife either.  The crow watches.  O.S. "meow".

head_text.subj: WITH ERIC AS HE TURNS TO SEE THE CAT

text: I guess I'm not ready to leave... just yet. He picks up the cat -- wary of flashes, which don't come time -- and returns to the window.  Feeling safer.
The last time we saw each other, I didn't do so well. (holds cat up)
Huh, Gabriel? He moves to the fireplace.  With his free hand, lifts the Tragedy mask off its hook.  Puzzles it, fact-to-mask.
I bet you need some cat food... right?
Eric walking, the Tragedy mask hanging from his hip.  An occasional PEDESTRIAN passes without comment, brutalized by the city.  Eric, more confident, smells the night's bo
Two men around a trashcan fire.  We should recognize Tin- his black leather trench coat.  A wonderfully rude Rap tu a White WOman Tied Up In My Closet, Gonna Jab Her With A RAZZLES b.g.
As Eric reacts to what the crow has just seen.  Slows.  S And directs his attention toward the mouth of the alley.

He pulls the nickel plated revolver from the satchel.  FO he hands it across to RATSO, who removes the suitcase-siz box (the source of the music) from his shoulder to accept Ratso is a feral skull-head; street trash.

Albrecht hasn't gone three steps before Eric appears behi cat silent, matching pace. NB:  Eric has got a new black rock-n-roll shirt on... and shell casing from Funboy's gun tied in his hair.
Freeze. Albrecht startles; drops his file.  Nearly draws his gun.
Jeezus!  Don't ever do that, man! Albrecht pants, hysterical but calming down.  Eric waits.
I told you cops don't say "freeze". He retrieves Eric's doctored photo from the spill of pape
You, my friend, are dead.  I saw your body.  You got buried.
I saw it, too. Albrecht gathers up the file.  Eric stands there.  We rea is hesitant about touching the file.
Walk with me. As Albrecht comes up with the file as they walk.

head_text.subj: ERIC AND ALBRECHT ON THE STREET

text: You died, man.  I can't believe it but here you are.  Last year, you and your girlfriend --
I need you to tell me what you remember.  What happened to us?
You went out the window.  She was beaten and raped.  She died in the  hospital. They stop.  Eric didn't know this.  Fixes Albrecht with a
Hey, you asked, man. (beat)
She held on for thirty hours in  intensive care.  Hemorrhage, trauma.  He body just finally gave it up. (beat; regret)

I saw it and couldn't do jack for  her. Eric has grown increasingly distraught over Albrecht's li Now he turns to Albrecht and, holding Albrecht's temples his fingers, puts his thumbs over Albrecht's eyes.
We see Eric react to a brutal Flash... but we don't see t Flash.
And Eric tears from Albrecht; staggers back, now holding head.  His crow face slacked in realized horror.
You okay, man?  I mean, what just happened.
The venom of bad memories.  You were there; you saw her.  I saw you seeing her. Understandable nervous, Albrecht lights up a cigarette.
You gotta understand -- I was  hoping she'd talk, give me a lead, a clue, something to work with. But she only said one thing to me  before she died. Eric lowers his head, penitent.
My name.
(fizzles)
I'm sorry as hell, man.
Thirty hours.  A day of life, plus change...
Eric plucks the cigarette from Albrecht's lips, taking a contemplative puff from it.
Halloween is coming, soon.  You will have Top Dollar if you watch for me at the Showtime, tomorrow night.
I should be trying to stop you. Eric nods, keeping his eyes on the cigarette.
Thank you.  For giving a damn.
My pleasure.
Don't smoke these. As a bus grumbles past on the street, Eric pitches the bu simultaneously ducks out of frame.
to see a blank building wall.  Fire escape.  Darkness.  N He does a full 360 degree turn.  Eric is gone again.
Damn, I wish he wouldn't do that.
Coat flapping, Eric is standing on the bus roof as the bu away from Albrecht's position.
Lao has the partially disassembled rat skeleton in front as well as a mortar and pestle with some bits of crushed is smoking powdered rat bone in a pipe and Grange reports him.
The son of a bitch winked at me. The he jumped.  Three stories. Lao seems strangely unaffected by the bizarre nature of G tale.
Did you see an animal of any kind? Did you see a bird?
(puzzled)
No.  I saw a guitar. (beat; irritated)
This isn't some rock-n-roller you forgot to pay, is it? (beat)
There was a drawing on the wall  that looked like a bird.  In  blood. Lao's expression is one of sublime content.
Good. Grange
It could've been a chicken...
A LONG SHOT of the T-Bird parked across the street from t store as two figures -- T-Bird and Skank -- approach on t store side.
I wish to hell I had torched Gideon's, that fat fuck.
I wish to hell I knew who it was that made Tin-Tin into a voodoo doll last night.
They stop walking.  Look at each other and sanctimoniousl themselves.  Tin-Tin's big R.I.P. moment.  T-Bird indicat liquor store.
We need some smokes and some road beers.
Got it. Skank hustles toward the store.  T-Bird crosses to the ca
WIDEN ANGLE to include the car as he nears it.  Behind hi 12-year-old KIDS, AXEL and CHOPPER, enter the store after one wearing a long duster.
as the KIDS enter and split between the counter and magaz rack.  East Indian CLERK.  Two boys fight video game wars corner.  Skank browses, grabbing odds and ends.
as T-Bird climbs in, digs the last cigarette from his pac snaps his Zippo and in the sudden orange light, sees:
Eric's purloined Strat in the back sear reflecting the li
He tries to spin and draw his gun but Eric is upon him, n one of Tin-Tin's throwing knives right inside T-Bird's ea
What the fuck are you supposed to be, man?! INSERTS:  Eric liberates T-Bird's automatic from the shou holster; Eric's hand closes T-Bird's door for him.
I'm your passenger.  You drive. And stop talking.
on ignition key and gearshift, making ready.  As ordered.
He looks outside and sees Eric as the car fires up, pipes glasspacks grumbling.  Skank moves, BRISTLING.
What's all this happy horseshit? And the car peels out maniacally!  Skank tries to pursue the two KIDS draw weapons and freeze everyone in the stor
Alright, alright, alright -- everybody be cool and stay exactly where you are. Chopper hustles up to the counter and relieves Skank of a gigantic Auto Mag.
Whooooa, cowboy!  Cool gun. Off Skank's look of total outfoxed disgust.--
Vertiginous windshield POV of onrushing street, highspeed
Faster, T-Bird.  Faster.  You're a hell of a wheelman; you know you can drive faster.
Eric now holds T-Bird's own gun on him.  Eyes locked on T T-Bird's jump between Eric's nightmare visage and the roa
You call it, blood -- you got the gun. You just tell me where you want to go. Clearly T-Bird would relish bisecting Eric with a meat cl as he says this.  He's nervous and needs to hold the road
That's good.  We're going  someplace you've never been before.
as the car burns up the obstacle course of pavement, kick wake of litter.  PEDESTRIANS scurry to clear the way.
Parked in an alley, facing the street.  Two cops work on styro cups of steaming coffee.  MJ (driver) and SPEEG.
Smells like rain.
Smells like a septic tank.  You got that cream stuff?
In the bag. Speeg rummages inside the takeout bag.
I hate this cream stuff.  They can't even call it cream, legally. They snap to as the T-Bird blazes past, doing ninety.
What in the crap? MJ floors the pedal, drenching Speeg in coffee on takeoff
Ow! Owowoowowoowo, goddammit!
as the cruiser roars out to give chase.
Eric lends the chase car a backward look.
You caught one.  Drive faster.
Man, you gonna get us killed dead and I don't even know what you want! Eric cocks T_Bird's pistol and levels it at his face.

I want you to stop talking.  And  drive.  Drive faster. Eric rifles the glove box, tossing items out the window: for the gun.  Sunglasses.  A giant dildo (brief eyebrows- T-Bird).  Then: a roll of (previously established) gaffer tape.  What Eric needs.
as he sees a second cop car join the high speed pursuit,
You're very popular.  Thought you could handle this thing. T-Bird macho calcifies.  He's going to win.
To hell with you.
(wry)
Naturally.
Climbing swiftly toward the 100 mark.
A 3-way pursuit until the T-Bird reaches the outskirts of city.
All quiet... until the T-Bird ZOOMS past frame.  The lead tries to duplicate the T-Bird's corner-cut and starts spi It clips a light pole.  Rebounds into the path of MJ's un
as MJ stands on the brakes.  Collision imminent.  They ho
as MJ's unit broadsides the first cop car.
The T-bird careens through dockside silence, alone, then fishtails, SCREECHING, to a lung-compressing halt.
T-bird respirating like a jackhammer.  Eric holds stoic.
So what -- you gonna rape me now?
Time for your reward, T.  Payback with interest earned. Eric rips a long strip of tape from the roll.
A HIGH ANGLE of the car as Eric opens the trunk. ERIC'S POV - The Trunk. loaded with plastique, canisters, timers, arson paraphern
SLOW TILT starting with T-Bird's foot, firmly taped to th pedal.  Mummified into his seat.  Hands taped to the whee Throat taped hard against the headrest. The car is now in gear, idling.
He drops an incendiary right into T-Bird's lap.  T-Bird s No go.  Eric reaches in with a bungie cord.
A little restrictive?  Good. (chilling)
You held her down and raped her. You were the first.  She burned while you were inside of her. (re: bomb)
What's the lag on this?  About twenty seconds, would you say? T-bird thrashes, but he's immobilized.  Can't even budge wheel.
I've comrades in hell, T-bird. Give them my best. Eric activates the timer.  Yanks up hard on the bungie co
The bungie cord pulls T-Bird's foot all the way down on t pedal.

Eric steps back, plucks the guitar out as the car starts car roars for the edge of the dock, about a distance of a football field.  Eric examines T-bird's auto pistol and p clip. INTERCUTS:  as the car speeds for the water's edge, Eric bullets from the clip, one by one.
T-bird's eyes bug in horror and he goes MMMMMMMMHHH!
thumbing out the final bullet.
All gone.
Lifting off and blowing all to hell, a billion smithereen phosphorescent firs pattering into the dark water.  It hi Sinks.  Weird flare glow as the car quickly submerges.

heaving the gun into the distant water.  Plosh.  He produ Bird's accelerator.  Squirts it into the ground.  He prestidigitates and T-Bird's Zippo appears in his hand. flicks it and drops it into the flammable puddle.
walking slowly out of the scene as the firepool coalesces a burning crow shape.
CLOSE-UP of a frying pan busy burning some pretty firebom looking eggs.  Kind gross. ANGLE - DARLA AT THE STOVE. NOT THRILLED WITH HER OWN PROGRESS.
I never was too good at this  domestic shit.
staring outside at nothing in particular.  Yet.
Don't say "shit". (beat)
That's okay.  Corn Flakes are okay.  Anything. She pauses as she hears a lilting, faraway GUITAR STRAIN. Across the street she can make out the figure of Eric on roof playing the guitar.

head_text.subj: EXT. ROOF OF LOFT BUILDING DAWN

text: EXTREME CLOSE of a Pignose Amp.  More soft GUITAR strokes CAMERA FOLLOWS a patchwork a taped-together, jerry-rigged cables to: ANGLE - ERIC ON ROOF -- shirtless, crosslegged, his Crow streaked by the night's work.  His fingering is unsure an tries the tune again. INSERT - We she Shelly's engagement ring on a leather tho around Eric's neck.  Like an amulet.
He's got it right this time.  Strong, sure CHORDS.  Passi We can almost imagine him conjuring Shelly via musical so He holds a stroke, letting it ring.  Sun rises behind him
Hey, shut the fuck up! Eric's eyes, closed with the moment, dart left.  Funny.
Later.  Elly is seated on a stool..  Mickey gives her a c dog.
Chili dog for breakfast... it's original.
Mom tried to cook.
Oh.
Hey, Mickey, I need a special with everything.  No sawdust.
(to Elly)
Everyone's a comedian.  Enjoy. Mickey EXITS FRAME.
You're Elly, right?  I know your mom. Elly turns.  Grange sits next to her.  Lao's mirrored-win is parked across the street, b.g.
A lot of people "know" my mom. Grange points o.s., indicating he wants coffee from Micke
I know your friend, too -- the one that looks like a rock star.
I don't know you.
(easily)
I'd like to get in touch with him. Elly sizes Grange up.
You're not a cop, either.  What do you want him for?
I'm looking for a good guitar man.
Right. Grange withdraws a $10 bill from his wallet and slides it the countertop to Mickey.
You buying? (cuts him some slack)
He kinda wanders around.  You'll see him if you pay attention.
I need to find him kind of soon, Elly.

No shirt, the ring on the thong around his neck -- workou He twirls and performs odd Crow moves of increasing compl in the big open living room.  On purpose, he stretches ha against the bedroom doorframe. FLASH:  Shelly stands in the blue moonlight near the pict wearing a rococo Victorian gown.  PUSH IN TIGHT as she is embraced by a nude Eric.  He undoes the last few remainin that hold the gown in place.  FOLLOW THE GOWN as it crump down the length of Shelly's (also otherwise nude) body to floor...
hanging there, inviting the pain the FLASHES bring.  Brea as though he is pumping iron, pumping up.
embracing a ragged full-length dress that used to be Shel FLASH: Eric and Shelly (wearing the same dress), exchange extremely passionate and intimate KISS in the moonlight.
as he drops the dress.  Absorbing the pain and memories.

executing a complex roll that winds him up at the windows He grasps it with both hands. FLASH:  A series of CLOSE SHOTS of Eric and Shelly's HAND moving along the other's body.  Curves and dips and conto But Eric's gaze never leaves SHelly's eyes.
His GAZE similarly FIXED.  Bringing his hands away and cl them together, deep breath, fingertips pressed to his fac Kung Fu prep.  When he opens his eyes, the crow is there him on the sill.
That's better. He wipes his torso down with a towel.
It's almost time. He holds his hand in front of his face and he flexes it. HEAR tendons CRACKLE like a harness.  Closes it into a po fist.
TIGHT on Skank as he slams his fist down on the table.  H a black eye and facial scuffs from his liquor store encou

Top, I made the sumbitch!  Face all painted white like some kinda fuckin' kabuki homo! WIDE ANGLE to include all present:  Lao, Grange, Lao Guar and #2, Top Dollar, and a Sentry.  Top dusts up a line an rinses his nostrils with brandy.
Sounds like our "Crow" is out-maneuvering you.
"Our" Crow...?
Come now.  You've seen the  graffiti -- all over the city in the few hors it has taken your men to drop like plague victims. What about your turf, Top? (mockingly)
You don't seem to have ripped out anyone's heart yet.
(pissed off)
The night is young.
(hot)

The found T-bird flash-fried to what was left of his fucking car! Top is angry too, but won't show it to Lao.  He rises and to the window.  Neon glow.  Top sees something outside, b that really torques him off.
A phantom GRAFFITI ARTIST is spray-painting a crow shape condemned building right across the street.
Top whip-drawing an auto pistol and shooting below.
Hey, you little fuckweed!  That's against the law! His gun smoking.  Momentary empowerment.
I don't give a shit what kinda bird this guy is.

As Top turns from the window,  PULL BACK to incorporate t chunky shadows where the lights don't fall.  Eric is ther perched on the narrow exterior ledge...but we don't know until he opens his eyes, two dots of white in the blackne
LAO AT TABLE -- angered by this macho horseshit, annoyed time being frittered.
I am sitting over here. He SLAMS a palm on the table and the room goes silent.  T looks sheepish.
Do you think this childish machismo impresses me? (regains composure)

When I was a boy in Saigon I watched my country change one  block at a time,  one building at a time.  Whole lives erased.  A way of life, polluted.  Today, no  one forces me to move.  I use my powers to change your country, one block at a time,  one building at a time.
Nice speech.  What's it supposed to mean?
Your comprehension is not required.  Your cooperation and, indeed, your ability are the issues on the table. Top rallies to this.
Whatever you say, I can do. Skank looks around, nervous and jumpy, a contradiction to guarantee.
That's reassuring.
from the ledge.  Endstamp is for a .45 caliber.
He sniffs the cartridge.  We can see Funboy's cartridge i hair.  He fists the shell casing tightly.
Jittery, grabbing a clip for his own automatic.
What was that -- !? It wasn't anything.  Skank loads, stands and jacks the ac his gun.  Lao looks questioningly to Top Dollar.
Too many poppers, Skank.  Relax.  Heel.
A black blur as Eric arches through, spilling Top.
Eric back flips the length of the table and kicks the gun Skank's hand.  All react.  Weapons out.
spinning mid-air to land in Eric's open hand!

Death cleans house.  Standing on the table, Eric fires re under his own arm to clip Lao Guard #1.  He pivots, shoot and takes out Lao Guard #2 -- who slams backward into the door as it being opened by the Sentry outside.  Crash!  T door is shut again.
Grange sprays the room with a Calico 950 Auto, shoving La beneath the table for cover.
Bullets hit him and demolish everything behind him.  Skan the deck again.  Eric fires and Lao Guard #1 sucks three across the chest, firing convulsively against the ceiling the lights.
springing up from behind table.  But Eric is gone from th of fire and one shot strikes Skank, rising at the far end
making for the door, Grange as shield.  Lao draws a pisto opens and Lao shoots a Sentry to clear him out of the way
A last look back toward Eric and Grange hustle Lao out. Door SLAM o.s.  Top is out of ammo as Eric lands from abo frame right in front of him and slaps the gun from his ha
(awed but maintained)
You want my attention, man you got it.
Wounded but clawing toward Eric just the same.
It's him, Top!  He dusted T-Bird!
You have to be SKank. (to Top Dollar)
One moment. As he speaks, WIDEN FRAME as he turns and grabs the incom Skank by the hair.
Thank of a snappy comeback for me on your way down. Without a beat he pitches Skank right out the window!  Sk all the way down.
Damaged from the wreck, limping home, piloted by our pals and MJ.  Skank smashes down into the roof, imploding the flashbar and windshield.  MJ drenches his lap in fresh co
OwwwAAHHH son of a BITCH!
who watches with slow marvel from the shadows
Jesus Christ... He runs to assist the demolished cruiser.
Just Top, Eric, corpses, and lazily drifting gunsmoke.
Top Dollar, you're the only one here still wasting good air...
Five large, in the drawer right  over there.  I never saw you.
Do you know what you destroyed?
Take the dope, too. Eric backhands Top into the wall.  Gets in his face, seet
A year ago.  A very nice lady circulated a petition.  She died. Last Halloween.  Answer yes or no.
That's ancient history.
It's yesterday!  Do you know what you destroyed? Top Dollar yells right back at Eric's anger.
Who gives a fuck!  I'm a businessman.  You gonna do me, then do me and shut you're face!
You don't even remember...
I never forget anything, dickhead. That building was a sweep-and- clear; the bitch was a nuisance with her goddamned petition.  It got a little rowdy... end of story.

Rowdy.  Let me fill in some gaps  for you. And he grabs Top's head the way he grabbed ALbrecht's ear slams Top into the wall.  Nose-to-nose. FLASH:  Shelly backing away from oncoming Funboy in the l trying to retreat, nowhere to run, her home invaded, scar
Top is quivering, almost helpless in Eric's hypnotic gras Eric winces, hard, and -- FLASH:  Shelly cut, bleeding, struggling against T-Bird.
Viciously close, more intimate and lethal than anything.

You're a detail man, Top -- you need to see more. This time Top tries to twist from Eric's grasp but it's n FLASH: Shelly, comatose in ICU, eyes fixed and staring,  hoses darting in and out, cold blue refrigerator light. Bloody, bruised and broken (from Albrecht;s memory)
arching, stiffening in pain.
All of her pain, Top.  Thirty hours.  All at once... Eric bears down on Top Dollar again.  Top screams.  Blood to leak from his eyes, nose, ears.

...all for you. FLASH:  Rapidfire CLOSE-UPS.  A jagged compound fracture, jutting, Shelly's eye, blood-red sclera, purpled and sunk Her scraped-raw hand clawing at air.  Icebox lighting.  A SHOT of her monitor going flatline: eeeeeeeeeeeeee... TWO-SHOT - RESUMING ERIC AND TOP DOLLAR. as Top sags in Eric's grasp, terror fixing his wide-stari eyes.  Eric lets him drop like a laundry sack.
I didn't think you could handle it either. O.S. BANG of impact, heavy against the steel door.  Eric
as it is battered down by a squad of police using a power All weapons snap up to bear on Eric.
That's all she wrote, Bozo!  You stand down now, and that's an order!

using his foot to shove the massive conference table at t incoming SWATS while launching himself into the air, flip toward the window and arching through cleanly as the cops fire on command.  Bullets tear the room to pieces.
The fire escape's covered.
Picking up Eric on his dive through the window, bullets c him.  Immediate police fire from below sparks off the iro Eric ducks slugs balletically and scampers to the roof.

Eric somersaults over.  Bullets chip brick in his wake. STREET LEVEL - UP ANGLE TOWARD ROOF. Showtime girded police cars and MARKSMEN, Eric a distant shadow figure above.  Here comes a TEAM LEADER with a bul
On the roof!  Keep firing!  Keep firing! A fury of law enforcement ordnance cuts loose all around

head_text.subj: RESUMING ERIC ON SHOWTIME ROOF EDGE

text: A forearm up against the fusillade.  Below him --
Here come Lead SWAT and his Merry MEN.

Eric runs for it.  Half a story higher.  He hits the wall skitters up, gripping tiny cracks in the brickwork. ANGLE - RESUMING MEN ON FRONT SHOWTIME FIRE ESCAPE. Lead SWAT hesitates -- because of what he sees.
Holy shit, it's spiderman. He tries to pull a bead and fires too late.
What're you boy scouts staring at! Let's Go!  Let's go!  Let's go!
He sprints to the far edge and dives to the next lower ro As he lands he is nailed by a helicopter spotlight, borin from behind and above the row of buildings.
COPS below, COPS in the chopper, everyone rushing paralle Eric, trying to keep up.
PAN QUICK to the next ledge.  COPS right behind him on th as well. WITH ERIC - AS HE RUNS TO THE EDGE. and finds a void waiting there.  No connecting building.
staying ahead of the search light.  A fantastic series of moves that wind him up at the rear edge of the roof.
sighting Eric as the light picks him out.  Eric glances a them... then jumps.
He's off the roof.  We can't see him.
pulling his weapon off target, because there is not targe
Dammit to hell! (beat; to men)
Come on.
Eric lands like a falling safe, scattering garbage.  But okay, up and running.
as his escape is cut off by a police car that screeches t stop, blocking the exit.
as he backpedals, scanning for an alternate escape.
(from car)
Come on!
We can see Albrecht.  Eric dives inside and the car burns
Albrecht harried and frantic, but in control.
Keep your head down! He twists and turns the car, glancing rearward for pursui Gradually he calms down.
I figured you might need a ride  home. Eric looks up at him from his half-concealed crouch.
It's done.
I figured as much.  Did you cap off Funboy.
Funboy had to leave this mortal  coil.
Yeah, among others. (sees Eric's condition)
Hey, man -- you're hit.
It's only a flesh wound.
It's only fourteen or fifteen  flesh wounds. Eric sits up as the car gains distance.  Grabs the cigare of ALbrecht's mouth.  Takes his single puff.
You shouldn't smoke these. He pitches the smoke out the open car window.
Great.  Litterbug of the Living Dead. Eric turns back to Albrecht.
I'm finished. Eric shoots him a doubtful look.
I mean, I've done what I came to do.  It shouldn't hurt this much. But it will pass...
(not buying it)
Right. (beat)
You sure I can't just take you to  the emergency ward?
It hangs a turn and their escape is made.
They couldn't do anything for me.
How 'bout the morgue?
No.  I have one more thing to do.
Lonelier, less traffic, more deserted.

head_text.subj: ON ALBRECHT AND ERIC THROUGH WINDSHIELD

text: You're gonna kill somebody else. (beat; no response)

We're gonna stop and get a shit-load of Band-Aids? Eric is obviously fighting to stay centered, stay conscio His last fight has caused him a great deal of damage, tak lot out of him.  He needs to recharge.
I have to prepare for an  anniversary.  This coming night. HOLD on their two kinds of determination. as we
High blue sky.  It might even be pretty if it wasn't Detr

The TV flybank pulses with videotaped images of Club Tras various performers -- including Diabolique.  On several s one-by-one, various images of a guitar-playing Eric Drave FREEZE-FRAME as we PULL BACK to the desk.  Lao has the 8x the corridor gallery.  He places it within eyeshot and re work on the desk BELOW FRAME;  we can't see it yet, among scattered research and inconcubula.
Entering and crossing to the desk.  As he comes up to the he DRAWS BACK.
What... the hell is that?
(calmly)
This is a cobra, Mr. Grange.  Yes, it is real.
Revealing Lao with a sealed cage, holding a large, live c his hands.  The killing blade is nearby.
That thing is poisonous.
Extremely so. (beat)
You and I are the recipients of unwanted good fortune, in the form  of a man everyone is calling The Crow. Grange makes a face.  Can't keep his eyes off the cobra.
Give me a break.  That guy's a wacko...
I intend no slight to you, but I cannot find the English to adequately express just what he is.  I suppose Western mythology would describe him as a Fury.
Not a Plymouth Fury, I bet. Lao chuckles indulgently.
Do you know of spirit assassins? You do know the dead can rise? Properly motivated, of course.
Like some sort of zombie on a  revenge trip.
Mmm.  But tonight I can take what is his.
Only thing you'll get from that clown is a faster way to die.

To the contrary... ZZLIP!  Lao smoothly BEHEADS the snake with the Blade aga the stone surface of the desk and discards the writhing b He squeezes behind one of the eyes and a VENOM SAC protru like a dark pimento. LAO pulls it free of the milky, clinging tissue and EATS Off Grange's stunned expression.
...all the dying tonight will be  done by the former Eric Draven. Lao exhibits the blade to Grange as though it explains al
Who is only invulnerable so long as he cares about the dead.  When he begins to care about the living, you'll find his heart can bleed... and I want it to bleed for me.
Kill a dead guy? Lao POPS the second venom sac; swallows it.  Pleased.
Truly kill him.  So I may crush his skull and smoke it. Lao SHRUGS.  Grange can handle it.
Let it suffice that I need him... and to get to him, we'll need his  little friend. Finally, an assignment Grange can comfortable understand.

Eric, barechested, emotionally tapped, clean of makeup an but exhausted, his movements retarded and slack.  Staring fixedly into the fireplace,  where he burns everything he find of his past:  the junk from the makeup table, the ma photos of himself and Shelly.
Moving with Elly as she nears the open loft door.  She PE cautiously inside.
Without looking toward the door, he speaks.
What's going on...?
A remembrance. (beat)

A closure. And Eric consigns to the fire the DRESS we saw earlier. Holds a photograph in a broken frame.  Cracked glass.  Su Eric and Shelly, goofing for the camera. He chucks it into the fire.  Draws a deep breath.
Better now.  I feel good.  How are you, Elly, my friend? Elly is clearly uncomfortable, groping for an excuse just Eric.  Eric is staring at her, intently.
What is it?
I knew.  I knew I knew you.  Even with the makeup and stuff you wore. (beat)
You really loved her, didn't you?
The photo burns and blackens in the grate.
You brought flowers.  As long as  you don't forget her, Elly, she  lives.
(upset)
She's dead.  She's gone.  And now you're just gonna go away and never come back, too.  I hate this place; it isn't fair.
Elly... He draws her close.  Wipes away an errant tear with his t
Sometimes the people we care about are gone, for no reason.  Sometimes that's really tough.  I cry.  But if  the people we love are gone, we keep them -- He taps Elly's temple, then his won.
-- right here.  It's a big responsibility.  And that makes it  okay to mourn. (beat)
I know that if you weren't here, I'd be very sad. Elly gives Eric a hug.
You look funny without your white face on.  Like it's your day off or something. He quizzical expression amuses him.
Somebody here wants to meet you. Gabriel? Gabriel the cat has wandered near the fireplace to join t Elly is immediately smitten.  Happy.
I remember him!  Here, Gabriel... here kitty... Gabriel... Is he still yours?
I think he's yours, now. The cat seems to like that idea.  Elly wraps him hugely u her arms, talking to him: "How're you, Gabriel, whatcha d
While Elly is preoccupied with the cat, Eric gives up his bit of Shelly to the fire - a portrait photo of her, smal creased.  He puts it in the fire, watches it burn for a b then turns to Elly.
I have something else for you. BACK FOCUS as Eric lifts off his neck Shelly's ring for E inspection.  The ring twirls large in f.g.
Nobody ever gave me something like that before.  Ever. Eric places it around her neck.  Elly BEAMS.
Shelly would've wanted you to have it.  This way, you'll think of her  every time you see it...
And she'll be alive.  Up here. Elly TAPS her own temple with a smile, keeping one hand o ring.
Blowing wind.  TRICK-OR-TREATERS wisp past.  Ghosts, witc demons out for Halloween.
walking home with Gabriel zipped up inside her coat is El fire engine wails past in the opposite direction.
Strictly downscale building.  Elly to Gabriel"
You're gonna like it here. A car curbs across the street as she enters the building.
as the window cranks down to reveal Grange at the wheel.
Darla nervously smoking, doing her best to stay clean, bu jittery.  Elly enters the shabby living room with Gabriel arms.
I was wonderin' where you'd gotten to -- (she sees Gabriel)
Oh, Elly, honey, a cat.  Here?
He was a present.  Besides, we're moving anyway.  You said.
We'll discuss this later. Obviously.  You left the door open. DARLA points.  As Elly goes to close the door it opens.
Grange enters accompanied by two Asian martial arts STRON (Lao Guards #3 & #4).  Grange looks around, bemused, his avuncular.
Hi, Elly.  Remember me? Elly's surprise is evident.  Darla is just plain pissed o
I don't remember you.  And I don't remember inviting...
(to his MEN)
If she opens her face again, shoot her in the head.
Mouth stalling in the ON position as Lao Guard #3 pulls a gigantic gun, draws and cocks.
(panicked)
Mom -- !
as he scoops her up, captive.
He strolls the circuit of the room, stopping near the win
You should listen to your mother. She said no cats. Grange pitches Gabriel right out the window.
Gabriel! Grange pulls out a compact Polaroid camera.
Now that's the expression I want.
As she struggle mightily, to no avail, as Grange moves in snap his shot.
Say cheese. He snaps.  On the SX-70 WHIRR and flash white-out, we --

Dark clouds have gathered to highlight the sunset.  Eric the guitar - LOUD, the SHelly theme in a major key.  Wher before it was wandering, uncertain, now it's bold and heartbreaking.  Definitive.  Pain replaced by strength an sense of homecoming. As Eric gets to the end of it, the notes are flying out.. the climax, rips the guitar up over his head and brings i down -- SMASH -- on the Pignose.  He's finished here.
as the broken guitar SAILS OUT over the building edge.
As Eric comes down the stairs.  Notices the open door.
He enters, cautiously, to find an envelope laying in the of the floor.  He opens it.
with a note.
The crow flies past behind him as his expression hardens.
Eric brutally crisscrosses his arms with black vinyl tape
Pulling on black night-fighting clothes, skintight.
as Eric (seen in mirror) jabs his fingers into the white makeup and smears it on.
Eric marches along in plain view since everyone around hi to be in costume.  The wind whips his coat.  KIDS bustle him with trick-or-treat bags.  The crow perched on his sh
Somewhere, a few blocks over, a building is burning.
A fire engine races past on the street.  He steps out in wake and crosses over to --
waiting for him as he crosses to the fence.  Beyond the f in the distance, the church looms.
He pauses.  A KID in a Creature from the Black Lagoon mas comes, passes Eric, then comes back for a touch.
Trick or treat! Eric smiles.  Not tonight.
Eric is standing over the grave of Shelly Webster, lookin He holds for a moment then moves on.

Eric ascends toward giant oak doors, tres Gothique.  The flaps past, leading him. NEW ANGLE - TOP OF STEPS -- where waits the Skull Cowboy. Eric approaches, the Skull Cowboy interposes himself betw Eric and the huge double doors. Eric glares up, defiant.  Moves up the steps.  The Skull extends a skeletal hand.  STOP.
Stop screwing around.
Angry, ready to battle:  You talking to me?
Your job is done.  You interfere with the living again.
Tell me I'll get hurt.  That I  might die. (beat)
I've already done that.  I don't  need anyone's help.  Yours  included.
Eric lower, Skull Cowboy superior, the storm wild around
Do this thing and you will be vulnerable.  The blood will not return. (beat)
No powers.  No reunion.  Nothing.
Fine with me. He ADVANCES a step up; the Skull Cowboy Hold fast.
You'll be alone.
I'm already alone.
Through a castle keep-like slit, Grange monitors Eric's arrival.  He speaks into a headset.
We've got company.
Is he inside?
Eric Talking to dead air.  Almost arguing with it.  Eerie
As he talks into his mike he hefts a nightscoped, laser-s sniper's rifle.
He's just out front talking to himself.  You tell me.
Eric, eyes steely, stares down the Skull Cowboy.
Don't waste my time.
Very well, it's your ass. And the wind kicks up around them both, powerfully.

As the force of the storm dust-devils around him and begi disassemble him.  The fire in his eye sockets goes out. flies off an is pulverized by the wind.  The garments beg disintegrate and blow around, rotten cerements falling ap mid-air. ANGLE - ERIC ON STEPS -- transfixed by this unexpected development.  A shard of the Skull Cowboy blows past Eric and transmutes to dust!

head_text.subj: RESUME SKULL COWBOY AT TOP OF STEPS, (EFFECT)

text: Transparent, ancient bones, crumbling and blowing away.
As Eric lunges for what's left of his mysterious, smart-a mentor
Meeting only a swirl of vaporous dust where the Skull Cow heart would have been.
He has time to register the dust in his palm before it, t renders down to nothingness,  leaving a vague green glow dies.  And as he looks to the sky --
flapping down to land on Eric's shoulder.  Eric is astoni
But why are you still here?
No answer in the crow's eyes.
That's good enough for Eric.  He marches to the double do shoves them back.

location: AS ERIC COMES THROUGH THE DOORS

text: The high breeze blows in with him, disturbing dust in the disused Gothic dark.  Hollow cathedral ECHOES to sounds. giant 27" TV positioned on the alter, broadcasting static

head_text.subj: ERIC AS HE APPROACHES THE ALTER

text: Leery of potential danger from a thousand dark places.
Onscreen:  Elly, gagged with duct tape and handcuffed to ring bolted to a flagstone wall.  Could be anywhere insid church.
I believe our friend Elly call you Mister Crow. (beat)
Please acknowledge; the mike will pick you up.
I can see her.
Of course you can. ANGLE - GRANGE IN THE GALLERY --  in darkness.  The runni lights on his night-scoped, laser-sighted sniper's rifle THROWS vague sprays of eerie red and green light.
Don't permit your rage to cloud the issue.  I believe in barter. I propose a simple trade. Grange sights his weapon.

Bluring as Grange resights.  Eric is not the target.  Blu FINDS the crow at the far end of the nave, perched in fro a giant stained glass window. NEW ANGLE - GRANGE -- squeezing off two quick, SILENCED s ANGLE - STAINED GLASS WINDOW -- the first shot blows a ho some pastoral religious presentation.  TINKLE of glass. ANGLE - ERIC -- Spinning at the quiet !pfut! sound, to wi
SPinning and hissing venomously.
As before, but the crow is not as fast.
As it catches the dart and goes down in a flurry of feath
His knees buckle.  Sympathetic PAIN from the hit.
You intended to finish this evening in the cemetery.  I am  here to help you on your way.
Swapping his tranquilizer gun for a more lethal rifle, si scoped.  He sights the fallen Eric in a spray of green li
Groping for support to drag himself back to standing.
I've got him if you want him.
No shooting.
(into headset)

Move in, guys. HIGH ANGLE - THE SANCTUARY -- as Lao Guards #3 and #4 mov into light, closing on Eric's position in the center of i Both wield calico's and one bears a sword. CLOSE ANGLE - ALTER -- Lao makes his entrance from shadow wearing a brisk pugilist get-up, a practical fighting out Makes a show of drawing the killing blade.
I wish to possess what you have now.
I want the girl.  Unharmed.  Now.
I know.  That is why I will prevail.  Mr. Grange... ? Eric CRAMPS UP, CLUTCHING his throat in obvious pain.
Holding the crow by the neck, TIGHTLY.  He plucks the tra from the its body.

head_text.subj: RESUMING ERIC AS LAO MOVES IN CLOSER

text: Crashing to one knee, invisibly bludgeoned, struggling to breathe.  Lao has no fear, walking around the stricken Er
Sooner or later, my action were destined to bring me a genuine Fury.  And it turned out to be you. At last.  I appreciate your abilities as few mortals can. That's why I desire them.
You're too late.  There was a guy outside - on the stairs - you really need to talk to.  But he  turned to dust and blew away. (beat, gasping)
I don't have any power for you to take.
I don't believe that. Lao motions to Grange with the killing blade.  Grange REL his deathgrip on the crow.  MOVE IN CLOSE on Eric so we m perceive a palpable degree of relief.
Time for you to die for me. (beat)
Funny, how the dead can still bleed.  How they need air. Eric IMMOBILIZED as Lao DRAWS BACK the Blade.  To Grange:

Break its neck. ANGLE - RESUMING GRANGE AT WINDOW as he prepares to do di the bird. Over his shoulder, we PUSH in to the BULLETHOLE from the dart until we're in TIGHT CLOSE-UP of an eye watching thr the hole.
Albrecht digs through a sling bag of weaponry, trying to simultaneously monitor the peephole, muttering sotto to himself.
Had to go get yourself hip-deep in shit, didn't you, my friend. It begins to rain.  Albrecht glances resentfully toward t sky.
Give it a rest, huh? A hefts a machinegun, clipped over and under.  CUTS LOOSE full auto into the Madonna on the window.
As the window EXPLODES toward Grange and he sucks big hit behind, DROPPING the crow.  The bird hits the ground, fla weakly. LAO GUARDS #3 & #4 exchange a look and whip up their Cali RETURNING FIRE.
Albrecht takes cover as a lot of religious stuff is noisi destroyed all around his position.  Chunks of the window continue to disintegrate.
Eric tuck-and-rolls out of the way as we go CLOSE on Lao, screaming.

I said no shooting! Then he's ducking bullets himself as Albrecht STEPS IN th the blown out window, the machine gun stuttering on slugs The sanctuary comes apart around Lao.  He RETREATS to the and EXITS whence he came. TIGHT ON PEW -- ERIC DIVES just as Guard #4 comes after h the sword, which chomps into the wood and gets stuck ther Guard #4 releases it and cross draws his Calico as ERIC s back into the frame -- STRAIGHT UP. TIGHT ON GUARD #4 as Eric's lancing foot propels him back before he can fire. INTERCUTS -- ALBRECHT AND GUARD #3 scrambling to reload. changes magazine; Albrecht swaps clips. ANGLE - DOWN LENGTH OF PEW -- Guard #4 slides.  Sits up w gun as Eric, down-pew, grabs the sword. ANGLE - ALBRECHT AT WINDOW  firing now with a gun in each RESUME ERIC AND GUARD #4, who eats it from Albrecht's gun but not before he puts a round through Eric. Eric staggers back from the impact but keeps his feet.   RESUME ALBRECHT as he tosses away the dry pistol.  His ma gun jams, he fights to get the clip. ANGLE - GUARD #3 -- reloaded and rising, having caught Al dead-bang in the open by the window. MOVING ANGLE - WITH ERIC --  A complex leap with the swor flashing.  He lands near Guard #3 and SLASHES UPWARDS, bl CLOSE-UP - GUARD #3 -- screaming in pain, gaping DOWN O.S TIGHT ON ALBRECHT - looking UP, following the trajectory something AIRBORNE toward him. CLOSE-UP - GUARD #3'S Calico spinning mid-air with Guard HANDS still attached, severed mid-forearm by Eric's devas strike. ANGLE - ALBRECHT drops Guard #3 -- to REVEAL Eric in the background.  Eric salutes Albrecht with the tip of the sw WITH ALBRECHT as he moves into the nave, which has been t apart by gunfire.  Hazy smoke.  Two dead guys.  And Eric.
You sorta looked like you might need my help.
This isn't your place.  This isn't your fight.  And I don't need your help.
You're welcome.
Leave here.  Don't do this.  I don't want you here.
The hell you say.  This isn't just  about you any more. Eric stares dead-on at Albrecht, acidly, then BREAKS the sword, dropping the pieces and turning his back on Albrec pursues Eric to:
The crow FLAPS UPWARD through the void.  Eric grabs the t bellrope, testing it.  A final look to Albrecht.
Don't interfere.
You're bleeding, man.  You can't make it. Eric shinnies up the bellrope, ignoring Albrecht.
Watching as Eric dissappears from view, fast..  Grumbles.

You won't mind if I just take the stairs, then, smartass... He hefts his arsenal bag of hardware and begins to plod u steps. ANGLE - MOVING WITH ERIC ON THE ROPE -- A weird perspecti speed climb.  Zip!  All the way to the top.
Slanted, shingled, slippery, dark.  Lightning deep in the clouds.  The crow circles as Eric RISES INTO FRAME.

Here I am. DOWNFRAME lightning STRIKES the ornate LIGHTNING ROD (lar Victorian, lance-like) at the far end of the roof from th tower. SILHOUETTING Lao and Elly standing in front of it.  Elly flinches at the strike.
Can you fly, Crow man?
He stops his ascent to light a cigarette.
I ain't cut out for this superhero shit.

Lao SNAPS Elly's free handcuff to the dimly glowing  ligh rod and advances, one foot on either side of the peak of roof, his blade brandished. CLOSE MOVING SHOT - ERIC -- Hands up to grapple, but weaponless.  He spiders to meet Lao, suddenly PICKING UP and RUNNING along the precarious peak. Lao sees him coming, braces to strike, but Eric executes FLYING LEAP right over Lao's head. ERIC LANDS, SLIPS, sprawls sideways, clinging to the peak roof.  Lao hurries in to slash with the blade, as Eric av The steel RINGS.  Eric converts his dodge into a low spin that DUMPS Lao. Eric SPREAD-EAGLES to keep from falling.  Distantly, Lao similarly saves himself. NEW ANGLE -- THE FIGHT -- Here comes Lao, crabbing back t the peak.  Eric ROLLS to Elly's position, GRABS the light rod and tries to wrest it loose. SIZZLE OF FLESH as Eric's hands are scorched: the metal i blue-hot. MOVING WITH LAO as Eric battles to free the lightning rod closes up distance, gives a warcry and prepares to swing Eric WRENCHES the rod loose and turns to deflect Lao's bl The weapons spark as they meet... and there goes Elly, he handcuff freed, SLIDING DOWN THE ROOF SLOPE. ANGLE  -- ROOF SLOPE -- WITH ERIC  as he dodges Lao by us lightning rod to vault down to where Elly is about to sli the roof. With the rod embedded in the roof, Eric hangs on, and ell on to Eric. UP ANGLE -- LAO, a dark figure against the night sky, rai the sword.

Face me! Eric guides Elly to the top of one of the flying buttress When he looks up, Lao is gone. ANGLE - BELL TOWER -- Albrecht's head pokes up at last. around, finally spots Eric below and to the left.  YELLS,
Is he dead yet? INSERT - ALBRECHT'S HOLSTER as Lao's hand draws Albrecht' gun quickly. ANGLE - ALBRECHT AND LAO --Lao has blindsided Albrecht.

No.  You are. He jams the gun into the base of ALbrecht's neck and fire CLOSE ANGLE - ERIC - He's too far away to matter.  Shock. INSERT - ALBRECHT'S CIGARETTE as it rolls down the slope, trailing sparks, snuffing out. ANGLE - ERIC holding onto the lightning rod as lightning night above him. ANGLE -- LAO AT BELL TOWER, triumphant and a bit wild, SH
You've caused another death, Mister Draven!  The girl will die as well -- because of you!
The base of a triangle - Lao, Eric, Elly.
You go to hell, you pervert!
Rage over the loss of Albrecht.  He RISES, hurting but ma hell.  GLARES UP toward Lao.
And how many lives have you destroyed?

I took yours from you.  Your little girlfriend?  I took hers, too.  Your meaningless, petty life?  I took it so that tonight your existence might gain a purpose.  You're no avenger. You're mine. PUSH IN TIGHT ON ERIC. Eyes alight with hatred for Lao.
(to himself)
You're right, I'm not an avenger.  Not any more. As lightning strikes, Eric Fires his gaze TOWARD THE SKY.
SEEING the crash dive toward Lao through the row's eyes.

As the crow wings down INTO FRAME and lights on Lao's hea CLOSE-UP -- THE CROW ON LAO'S HEAD slashing with its claw Pecking out Lao's eyes. WITH ERIC -- on the roofslope as he totters but maintains climb, the crow/Lao UPFRAME B.G. RESUME LAO -- as the crow abandons him.  Lao STAGGERS AND down the roof - toward Eric. SLANTED ANGLE -- ERIC AND LAO -- Eric ARRESTS Lao's fall, fisting lapels and bringing him nose to nose.  Fury.
Time for a sacrifice. Lao's face is a hideous bloody mask with black holes wher eyes used to be.  He smiles gruesomely.

I don't need eyes to take what I want from you. He EMBRACES Eric and RAMS the killing blade deep into Eri back! ON ERIC as he looks down to see the blade protruding from sternum.  Tight grimace.  A lot of pain.
Can you fly? He pulls Lao into a BACKWARD ROLL down the roof, HOLDING TIGHT.

Eric lands on his back, forcing the blade THROUGH himself INTO Lao.  Eric completes the roll and KICKS Lao off INTO the killing blade still embedded in him! WITH LAO as crashes, sliding, sprawling down PAST Elly's position.  Gets to his knees atop the flying buttress.  S blade in his own chest. CLOSE-UP - ELLY - she sees it all happen. RESUME LAO - a regretful look toward Eric.  He PLUMMETS o roof edge. ANGLE - ERIC SLIDES DOWN ROOF --  He slows, stopping when is in frame.  He clutches his own chest.  Regards his own shaking hand, drenched in his won blood.  Glazed. ON ELLY, as she finally gets the duct tape off her mouth, to get to Eric.  She flails and cries out.
Don't let me fall! CLOSE-UP -- their hands finally meet and GRASP TIGHT.

A low angle TRACKING SHOT (as when we first met Elly). Eric's and Elly's feet pass graves.  Eric's pace is slow, limping.  They STOP at a grave where elly BENDS INTO FRAM the flowers there. Eric is bloody and out of it.  She helps him walk.
Now do you get to see her? Shelly, I mean.
In a better place.  I hope.
You're not gonna come back, are you? Eric's response is halting and uncertain.  But he tries t her hope.  He reaches for Shelly's ring around her neck, it up to her.
I don't know if I can.  But you have this... and you know where to come.
You mean you'll, like' dig your way out of the grave?  Euww. Eric is amused by this in spite of his grievous injuries. He grasps Elly's face in his hands and bends, painfully,t her on the forehead.
For you, I'll try.  Promise.

Spent, empty, he holds the rose determinedly, but he's ne going to make it the few yards back to his own grave.  So His legs finally go and he collapses onto the humus.  One groping hand tries to drag him further.
Leave me now.
Tears on her face.  She can't watch this.  She TURNS and the flowers on Shelly's grave.
Still too far away to matter.

He gives it up, his face sinking into the wet grass for a before SHELLY'S HAND intrudes INTO FRAME to GRASP his han No ethereal glow, no heavenly choir... just a near-dead E blank-faced astonishment, and he moves forward.
She struggles to get her hood up against the rain and rou wipes the moisture from her face with her sleeve.  She tu toward Eric's grave.  Then, surprised, she looks close.
Eric is gone.  The white rose lies neatly on the top of t undisturbed  earth there.
Emphasizing that Elly is now ALONE in the graveyard. LOW ANGLE on Elly, ROSE in the foreground -- She walks OFF.  HOLD the rose.

A grey day but no rain.  Elly stands wistfully by the win her doll on standby.  The apartment is in order and perha notice a few new items.  Gabriel the cat, miraculously AL sprawled on a chair, licking himself.  Darla BUSTLES INTO B.G.  Her wardrobe more upscale, her hair done.  Her mann hectic but natural.
Worktime, kiddo.  First day, new job, gotta go. This does not get the expected smile from Elly.
You sure you're gonna be okay? Elly turns from the window and NODS silently.

The aforementioned grey day in the city. ANGLE - DARLA AND ELLY AT THE WINDOW. Darla comes up.  Arm around Elly.  Cheer up; he attitude more connected and loving.  PUSH IN ON ELLY so we know sh clutching SHelly's ring tightly in her hand.  Darla looks Elly, out the window.
At least it finally stopped raining.
It can't rain all the time. Darla kisses Elly on the temple and it out the door.  Ell her hand to consider the ring.  She looks back out the wi
Elly is looking right at it.  Same crow.  We're positive. Elly.  It TAKES WING and flies away.
An UP ANGLE from Eric's grave toward the tree as the crow INTO FRAME and perches there, shucking water.  PUSH IN on crow.  Watching.  Waiting.
